column3:
A little boy named Joey did not like to brush his teeth. One day, as his mother asked him
ewlineto brush his teeth, Joey said, "I don't want to! It's gross and a waste of time!" In
ewlineresponse, Joey's mom told him that in order for him to grow up and be big and strong like
ewlineshe is, he must brush his teeth. In disgust, with his mom watching to make sure he brushed
ewlinehis teeth right, he brushed his teeth and whined until he was finished. The next day, Joey
ewlinedid not brush his teeth and told his mom that he did. After going to school, one of Joey's
ewlinefriends said that his breath stunk and began to make fun of him. This made Joey very
ewlineangry, so he pushed the boy over and started to cry. A teacher came over and called the
ewlineprincipal as both kids were being loud and starting a fight. Joey's mom came to school and
ewlinetook him home. After asking what was wrong, Joey told his mom that he didn't brush his
ewlineteeth. After hearing this, his mom marched him up to the bathroom and forced him to brush
ewlinehis teeth. "You won't get teased if you brush your teeth, Joey!" she yelled, and then left
ewlinethe room. From that day forward, Joey brushed his teeth every day so the other kids
ewlinewouldn't make fun of him.
column4: one: What did Joey's friend do?
column7: He made fun of his stinky breath.
column9: multiple: What did Joey's mom say would happen if he brushed his teeth every day?
column11: He would grow up to be big and strong.
column14: multiple: What did Joey do after his mom yelled at him?
column16: He didn't go back to school.
column17: He only brushed his teeth sometimes.
column18: He brushed his teeth every day after that.
column19: one: What did Joey not like to do?
column20: He didn't like to go to school.
column21: He didn't like to eat his breakfast.
column22: He didn't like to brush his teeth.
